901.01 PROTECTION DURING CONSTRUCTION, EXCAVATING, GRADING; REMOVAL OF DEBRIS;
DEPOSITS.
   (a)   Before proceeding with any construction, enlargement, alteration,
repair or removal of any building or other structure, in the construction of
which it is desired or may be necessary to make use or to drive across the
curb, tree lawn, sidewalk, ditch or culvert, the owner shall construct and
maintain a plank driveway, to the approval of the Inspector of Buildings,
across and over such curb, tree lawn, sidewalk, ditch or culvert, so that the
same shall not be injured or damaged. Before such plank driveway is
constructed, and at the time of securing a permit for the construction,
enlargements, alteration, repair or removal of any building or other structure,
such owner, or his agent shall deposit with the Clerk of the City the sum of
one thousand dollars ($1,000) for all sublots located in a U-1 or U-2 District,
and three thousand dollars ($3,000) for all sublots in all other districts, as
a guarantee that such plank driveway will be constructed and maintained, and
that if any curb, tree lawn, sidewalk, ditch or culvert is disturbed or broken
the same will be replaced as above provided at the cost and expense of the
owner. Upon the failure to replace or restore such curb, tree lawn, sidewalk,
ditch or culvert so displaced or broken, to the satisfaction of the Building
Commissioner, the Commissioner shall have such work performed and shall pay the
cost and expense thereof out of the fund so deposited. In the event the sum so
deposited is not sufficient to pay such cost and expense, the owner shall be
liable to the City for any balance. However, if such curb, tree lawn, sidewalk,
ditch or culvert is left in a condition acceptable to the Commissioner, the
fund so deposited shall be returned to such owner, and any part of the fund
remaining after the repairs, if any, are made, as hereinbefore provided, shall
be returned to the owner.
   (b)   In addition, the above deposit shall cover any construction involving
excavation, grading, filling or the hauling of earth to and from the site of
such construction. Upon completion of the work for which such permit was
granted, the applicant shall notify the Commissioner to make an inspection for
the purpose of determining what refund, if any, shall be made from the deposit.
If it becomes necessary for the Commissioner to make more than one inspection
for such purpose, a fee of thirty-five dollars ($35.00) shall be charged for
each inspection after the first. All charges shall be deducted from the
deposits, and the balance shall be refunded subject to the following
conditions. The Commissioner or other City official shall cause to be removed
all earth, debris, or building materials which may be placed, left or permitted
to remain on any pavement, sidewalk or tree lawn, in the City in the course of
the work for which permit was granted, or on any private property in the City
without proper permission. The cost of such removal shall be charged against
the applicant, and the deposit shall be paid to the City Treasurer for the use
of the General Fund. Any balance remaining shall be refunded to the applicant
as aforesaid. If the cost is greater than the deposit, the applicant shall be
billed for the unpaid portion, and, if not paid in ten days from billing, the
matter shall be referred to the Law Director for collection.
(Ord. 2003-082. Passed 8-5-03.)
901.02 CURB CUTTING.
   (a)   Any person desiring to have curbing removed from any public street or
highway in front of any lot of which he or she is the owner or lawful occupant,
may make application therefor to the Building Commissioner for a Street Opening
Permit. Upon such application being made and the payment of the fee required by
Section
1333.04 of the Warrensville Heights Code, the Director of Public Service will
approve such curb cut provided the cut can be lawfully made and the use of the
curb cut for ingress/egress will not create unsafe conditions or impact traffic
flow. The curb can only be cut in the manner prescribed by Council and as
approved by the Engineer.
   (b)   When curbing is cut for driveway purposes, and such driveway is to be
constructed or paved, the cutting of the curb must be completed prior to the
paving of the driveway.
(Ord. 2008-098. Passed 9-2-08.)
901.03 CONSTRUCTION OF CITY OWNED OR DEDICATED LAND.
   (a)   No person shall enter upon land owned by the City dedicated for a
street or utility right of way for the purpose of construction or
reconstruction thereof without first having obtained a permit from the Building
Commissioner. The Building Commissioner shall not issue such a permit, except
for sudden emergency, unless and until the plans for the construction or
reconstruction of any street, highway, sanitary sewer, storm sewer and water
line, together with the appurtenances thereto, have been approved by a
resolution of Council.
   (b)   Council shall, prior to approval of such plans, have a report from the
City Engineer that the proposed construction or reconstruction is in accordance
with applicable engineering standards; shall find that the improvement as it is
proposed is not detrimental to the public health or safety and is consistent
with all of the applicable laws of the City and other applicable government
standards; and shall require sufficient insurance and bonds guaranteeing that
the proposed improvements will be constructed to completion in accordance with
the approved plans and that the applicant will preserve and protect the City
from any claims and demands.
   (c)   Council shall attach such other conditions and requirements to the
development as the submitted plans and specifications may require for the
benefit of the City, the residents, the present and future users’ improvement
and the other affected persons.
(Ord. 2003-082. Passed 8-5-03.)
901.04 PERMIT FOR STREET AND SIDEWALK OPENING; DEPOSIT (Company Check,
Certified Check or Money Order Only).
   Permission may be granted to work within the public Right of Way to work on
underground utilities or to remove and replace existing pavement, curb, gutter,
sidewalk, grass or landscaping, provided that the consent of the Director of
Public Service is first obtained and the necessity of such work is established
to his satisfaction. A fee of thirty dollars ($30.00) shall be collected by the
Building Department for each such permit application. The applicant shall also
deposit monies simultaneously with the issuance of such permit as guarantee
that all backfill, roadway base, pavement and surface restoration meets the
pre-existing conditions or the City standard details (whichever is more
stringent). Deposit monies will also be used for inspection costs. Deposits
shall be deposited with the Building Department and be determined based on the
following: One hundred fifty dollars ($150.00) per square yard of surface
pavement to be disturbed, thirty dollars ($30.00) per lineal foot of curb or
gutter cut or removed and replaced, and ten dollars ($10.00) per square foot of
sidewalk. In no case shall such deposit be less than one thousand dollars
($1,000) for a curb cut or work outside of the pavement (between the curb/
pavement and the Right of Way). In no case shall such deposit be less than two
thousand five hundred dollars ($2,500) for work within the pavement. Deposits
may be increased in non-typical situations where the City's exposure would not
be covered by the standard deposit. Each pavement opening, curb cut or sidewalk
removal requires a separate permit; however, if curb is removed and replaced as
part of a contiguous road opening, a single permit is adequate.
(Ord. 2008-98. Passed 9-2-08.)
901.05 REFILLING; FINAL INSPECTION; REMEDY OF CITY FOR DEFECTIVE WORK.
   All street pavements, backfill, bedding, curbs, gutters, sidewalks,
treelawns, landscaping, signs, fences, utilities and features within the Right
of Way removed or damaged shall be replaced and repaired by such permittee
under supervision of and to the satisfaction of the Director of Public Service.
Inspection of the backfill operations and pavement restoration shall be
coordinated with the Building Department and the City Engineer. If inspections
are not coordinated 72 hours in advance and inspections do not occur, the City
will hold the deposit for one (1) year prior to re-inspection of the finished
repairs. If either inspection is to the satisfaction of the Director of Public
Service, he shall so notify the Director of Finance, who shall thereupon return
the guarantee deposit. If the inspection discloses a defect or unsatisfactory
work that is unacceptable to the Director of Service, he shall notify the
permittee of such defect or condition, and the permittee shall have ten days in
which to rectify the same or forfeit the guarantee deposit, in which case the
Municipality shall thereupon complete the repair or replacement. The City
Engineer may act on behalf of the Director of Public Service, however, the
Director of Public Service has the final word in case of a dispute.
(Ord. 2008-98. Passed 9-2-08.)
901.06 ADDITIONAL DEPOSIT.
   Notwithstanding Section
901.01, the Director of Public Service is authorized and directed, in
determining the amount of money to be posted and requiring a minimum deposit of
fifty dollars ($50.00), to require additional sums if it is necessary to do so.
(Ord. 2003-082. Passed 8-5-03.)
901.07 REPAIR OF OPENING; REFUNDS.
   If it is determined by the Director that the repair/restoration is not in
accordance with City requirements or approved plans, the Director shall notify
the permit holder to repair same within a period of ten days. Any permit holder
who fails to comply with the demand of the Director, in repairing the
deficiencies, shall be deemed to have forfeited the money posted, and the City
will perform the necessary work and pay for said work from the deposit money.
However, if such repair as made by the Municipality costs less than the balance
remaining, all unused deposit money shall be returned forthwith to the permit
holder.
(Ord. 2008-98. Passed 9-2-08.)
901.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor.
(Ord. 1956-68. Passed 7-2-56.)

903.01 SUPERVISION OF CONSTRUCTION; ENFORCEMENT.
   Under the direction of Council, the Building Commissioner or his designated
assistant shall supervise the construction, repair or alteration of necessary
sidewalks, curbing or gutters or parts thereof, and shall issue permits for
such work as required. The Chief of Police is charged with the enforcement of
this chapter where any violation may affect the public safety and welfare.
(Ord. 1957-33. Passed 3-19-57.)
903.02 CERTIFICATE REQUIRED FOR CERTAIN SUBLOTS.
   The Building Commissioner is authorized and directed, prior to the issuance
of a building permit, on sublots wherein sidewalks have not been installed or
wherein sidewalks are in a broken or dangerous condition, to require a
certificate executed by the owner of the sublots and providing for the
installation of sidewalks in accordance with plans and specifications presently
on file in the office of the Clerk of Council.
(Ord. 1956-26. Passed 2-20-56.)
903.03 PROPERTY OWNER RESPONSIBLE FOR SIDEWALKS, CURBING AND GUTTERS.
   Every owner, occupant, person or agent having charge of any building, lot or
land fronting on any street or other public road is hereby charged with the
construction, maintenance and repair of necessary sidewalks, curbing and
gutters, or parts thereof, within the corporate limits.
(Ord. 1957-33. Passed 3-19-57.)
903.04 SIDEWALK SPECIFICATIONS
   All sidewalks hereafter constructed, repaired or altered in any public
street shall be installed and constructed as follows:
   (a)    Five feet in width, with the property side of such walk parallel with
and six inches distant at right angle measurement from the street line, except
streets which have an existing walk, in which case all new walk or replaced
walk shall conform to the width now existing.
   (b)    The top surface shall at all points coincide with the line described
as follows: beginning at the curb line at the established curb grade as
determined by the Council; thence extending to the street line at right angles
to the curb line with a rise of three-eights of an inch to the foot.
   (c)    Concrete walks shall be installed on a two-inch cinder or sand bed
with a minimum concrete thickness of four inches. The concrete shall be
monolithic with a 1:2:3-1/2 mix and shall be well mixed, carefully placed and
broom finished.
   (d)    Sandstone or bluestone walks shall have a minimum thickness of two
and one-half inches and shall be laid on a two-inch cinder or sand bed.
   (e)    All walks of either stone or concrete constructed across driveways
shall have an additional thickness of one and one-half inches for the full
width of the driveway. (Ord. 1957-33. Passed 3-19-57.)
903.05 REPAIR OR REPLACEMENT OF SIDEWALKS.
   (a)    Any existing walk or flagging which differs in grade from the
adjacent walk or flagging by an amount exceeding three-eighths inch shall be
deemed unsafe and dangerous to the public and shall be repaired or replaced.
   (b)    Any existing walks or flagging whose grade is such that water
collects or stands thereon shall be deemed a menace to the public and shall be
repaired or replaced.
   (c)    Any walk or flagging which is more than twenty percent broken, has
cracks exceeding one-eighth inch in width or shows evidence of disintegration,
is hereby condemned and ordered repaired or replaced.
   (d)    The Building Commissioner is authorized to decide the type of walks
to be installed in replacement and repair work.
   (e)    Any and all existing sidewalks or parts thereof which fail to conform
to the standards herein set forth are hereby condemned and ordered repaired,
relaid or replaced.
(Ord. 1957-33. Passed 3-19-57.)
903.06 NOTICE TO PROPERTY OWNER; REMEDY OF CITY FOR NONCOMPLIANCE.
   Whenever Council declares by resolution that certain specified sidewalks,
curbs or gutters, or any part thereof, shall be constructed or repaired, the
Clerk of Council shall cause written notice of the passage of such resolution
to be served upon the owner or agent of the owner of each parcel of land
abutting on such sidewalks, curbs or gutter, as provided by law, together with
a description of the amount and character of the work necessary to be done and
its location and estimated cost. If such sidewalks, curbing or gutters, or
parts thereof, are not constructed within fifteen days or repaired within five
days after service of such notice, the Building Commissioner shall have it done
at the expense of the owner and report the cost thereof, including the cost of
engineering, inspection, interest, legal service, serving of notice, clerical
work and advertising, to the owner and to Council. Such cost shall constitute a
lien on the property abutting on such sidewalks, curbing or gutter, from the
date that it is so reported to the owner, and shall be paid by such owner to
the Director of Finance of the Municipality. If such cost of constructing or
repairing is not paid within ten days from the time it is so reported to the
owner, the Clerk of Council shall certify it, together with a penalty of five
percent thereon, to the County Auditor, who shall place it on the tax duplicate
and collect such cost and penalties in the same manner as other taxes are
collected.
(Ord. 1957-33. Passed 3-19-57.)
903.07 PERMIT FOR CONSTRUCTION.
   Before constructing, altering or repairing any sidewalks, curbs or gutters
in any public street, every owner, occupant, agent or person charged with
construction, alteration or repair shall first obtain a permit, in writing,
from the Building Commissioner or his authorized assistant, showing the nature,
amount and location of the work to be done, which permit shall be free.
(Ord. 1957-33. Passed 3-19-57.)
903.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter or fails or neglects to
comply with any such provision is guilty of a minor misdemeanor for each
violation. Each day's continued violation shall constitute a separate offense.

915.01 CONNECTIONS TO PUBLIC SEWERS AND WATER LINES; LICENSE REQUIRED.
   No house sewer or other sewer or water line shall be constructed to connect
with a public sewer or water line, nor shall any connection be made to a public
sewer or water line within the Municipality, except by a person licensed by the
Municipality or the City of Cleveland to do such work.
(Ord. 2006-022. Passed 3-7-06.)
915.02 SANITARY SEWER TAP-IN FEES.
   (a)    No person shall connect to the Sanitary Sewer System within the City
of Warrensville Heights without paying the appropriate tap-in fee (payable to
the “Warrensville Heights Director of Finance”). No person shall connect to the
Sanitary Sewer System or perform any work within the City right-of-way without
first obtaining a permit and approved plans from the Building Department,
pursuant to Section
 901.03 of the City Code. Additional deposits for engineering review and
inspection may be required prior to issuance of a permit. Coordinate
engineering and inspection fees with the Building Department at the time of
application.
   (b)   Residential Properties.
      (1)   Single family units:  The sanitary sewer tap-in fees shall be
$2,000 per “equivalent dwelling unit” (EDU) for properties within the City
limits. For properties outside of the City limits that are tapping into
Warrensville Heights Sewers, the tap-in fee shall be $3,000 per EDU. An
equivalent dwelling unit (EDU) is a residential house with up to four (4)
bedrooms. The minimum tap-in fee for a property shall be based on one (1) EDU.
      (2)   Multiple Family Units: The sanitary sewer tap-in fees shall be
$2,000 per “equivalent dwelling unit” (EDU) for properties within the City
limits. For properties outside of the City limits that are tapping into
Warrensville Heights Sewers, the tap-in fee shall be $3,000 per EDU. For
multiple family units, an equivalent dwelling unit (EDU) has a design flow of
400 gallons per day. The minimum tap-in fee for a property shall be based on
one (1) EDU.
The number of EDU’s for each one (1) bedroom unit in a multi-family building
shall be 0.625 EDU’s.
   The number of EDU’s for each two (2) bedroom unit in a multi-family building
shall be 0.75 EDU’s.
The number of EDU’s for each three (3) bedroom unit in a multi-family building
shall be 0.875 EDU’s.
The number of EDU’s for each four (4) bedroom unit in a multi-family building
shall be 1.0 EDU’s.
The total number of EDU’s within a building shall be used to determine the tap-
in fee for each multi-unit building.
   (c)   Commercial Properties. The sanitary sewer tap-in fees shall be $2,000
per “equivalent dwelling unit” (EDU) for commercial properties within the City
limits. For commercial properties outside of the City limits that are tapping
into Warrensville Heights Sewers, the tap-in fee shall be $3,000 per EDU. For
commercial properties, the average daily flow for each building shall be
determined and approved by the City Engineer. The tap in fee shall be based on
the number of “equivalent dwelling units (EDU’s). For commercial buildings, an
equivalent dwelling unit (EDU) has a design flow of 400 gallons per day. The
minimum tap-in fee for a property shall be based on two (2) EDU’s.
(Ord. 2006-022. Passed 3-7-06.)
915.03  BOND REQUIRED; PERMIT REVOCATION.
   Each sewer builder, plumbing contractor or other person proposing to
construct such sewer or water line or make such sewer or water line connections
within the Municipality shall, before performing any work under his license,
deposit with the Director of Finance a bond or two thousand dollars ($2,000)
with a surety company authorized to write surety bonds in the State, as surety
for each permit issued and outstanding, conditioned that he will indemnify and
save harmless the Municipality from all loss and damage that may be occasioned
in any way by accident caused by the lack of care, skill or attention or the
use of defective material on the part of the licensee or of anyone in his
employ, in the prosecution or to be made by him, or of the placing of any
material in any street or public highway in the making of any connection with
any water pipe or sewer, as aforesaid, and conditioned also that he will
promptly, at the proper time, replace and restore, or cause to be replaced and
restored, the street and pavement over such opening to as good a state and
condition as he found it previous to opening the same, or pay the Municipality
for having the same replaced or restored, as the case may be, and that he will
conform in all respects to the rules and regulations which may from time to
time be established by the lawfully constituted authority of the Municipality
governing the construction of or connection with such sewers or water lines. A
permit shall be deemed to be outstanding within the meaning of this section
until the Plumbing and Heating Inspector shall have certified that the work
authorized under such permits has been completed in conformity with the rules
and regulations governing such work. Upon such certification of completion
being entered upon the records, such bond shall be considered as released and
the obligors thereof discharged. If the work authorized by such permit is not
completed in accordance with the rules and regulations therefor, the Plumbing
and Heating Inspector may so notify the sewer builder and the surety upon such
bond, and if the work is not thereafter completed within the time required by
the Plumbing and Heating Inspector he may order the work done, and the costs
and expenses thereof shall be charged against such bond. The failure on the
part of any sewer builder or other person licensed hereunder to complete the
work authorized under any given permit in accordance with the rules and
regulations for such work shall authorize the Plumbing and Heating Inspector to
revoke any and all permits issued to such sewer builder or other person
licensed hereunder and then outstanding, and shall also authorize the Plumbing
and Heating Inspector to refuse to issue any further permits to such sewer
builder or other person licensed hereunder unless Council shall, by resolution,
direct the issuance of further permits.
(Ord. 1947-3. Passed 1-8-47; Ord. 2001-27. Passed 5-1-01; Ord. 2006-022. Passed
3-7-06.)
915.04  PLANS FOR SEWAGE TREATMENT PLANTS; APPROVAL BY COUNTY HEALTH BOARD.
   The Building Commissioner is hereby ordered to require all applicants for
permits to construct or alter a dwelling within the Municipality, to which a
sanitary sewer is not available, to secure the approval of the Cuyahoga County
District Board of Health of all plans and specifications for the treatment
plant to be constructed for use in connection with the occupancy of such
dwelling. Until such approval of the Cuyahoga County District Board of Health
is secured by such applicant, the Building Commissioner shall refuse to issue a
permit to construct or alter such dwelling within the Municipality. However,
should such application be for a permit to alter a dwelling upon a parcel of
land where a sewage treatment plant has already been constructed and such plant
has adequately disposed of the sewer from such dwelling, such approval shall
not be required.
(Ord. 1944-28. Passed 5-18-45; Ord. 2006-022. Passed 3-7-06.)
915.05 MATERIAL SPECIFICATIONS.
   (a)   All sanitary sewers installed and constructed in the Municipality
shall be constructed of ASTM C-700 vitrified clay pipe which has full
compression flexible joints and fittings, as hereinafter specified. However, in
the case of sizes larger than twenty-four inches in diameter, such sewers may
be constructed of concrete pipe with watertight joints approved by the
Engineer.
(Ord. 1958-130. Passed 11-25-58.)
   (b)    All storm sewers installed and constructed in the Municipality shall
be constructed of ASTM C-700 vitrified clay pipe and shall have full
compression flexible joints and fittings, as hereinafter specified. However, in
the case of sizes larger than eighteen inches in diameter, such sewers may be
constructed of concrete pipe with watertight joints and classes approved by the
Engineer. All storm sewers shall be installed in a trench separate from the
sanitary sewer unless otherwise approved by the Council.
(Ord. 1966-13. Passed 3-8-66; Ord. 2006-022. Passed 3-7-06.)
915.06 COMPRESSION JOINTS.
   The vitrified clay pipe shall have the joint material on both the bell and
spigot ends made of a flexible corrosion and acid-resistant material designed
to provide a full compression joint, which material shall be securely bound to
the pipe at the factory in molds so shaped as to fabricate a convex ring on the
spigot end of the pipe and a symmetrical concave ring in the bell end of the
pipe. The material shall be of such dimensions that when the two ends are
engaged, a mechanical joint under uniform compression is formed.
   During installation, the joint material on both the bell and spigot ends
shall be wiped clean and throughly wetted with clean water, or coated with a
compound furnished by the manufacturer, to facilitate assembly. The spigot end
shall be inserted in the bell and pressure applied until the pipe is properly
sealed. The joint, when engaged, shall be flexible enough to allow reasonable
deflection in any direction and still maintain uniform compression.
(Ord. 1958-130. Passed 11-25-58; Ord. 2006-022. Passed 3-7-06.)
915.07 FITTINGS.
   All fittings used with the vitrified clay pipe shall also use the joint
material specified in Section
 915.05 at both ends.
(Ord. 1958-130. Passed 11-25-58; Ord. 2006-022. Passed 3-7-06.)
915.08 SIZE OF SEWERS.
   (a)    All sanitary sewers serving single-family or two-family dwellings or
apartment buildings shall be of the material hereinabove specified and shall
have a diameter of at least five inches. Sanitary sewers serving local retail
stores or commercial, light industrial or other business establishments shall
be of the same material and length as herein specified but shall be of such
diameter as the Engineer shall specify, based upon the sewage capacity of such
store or establishment.
   (b)    All storm sewers serving single-family or two-family dwellings or
apartment houses shall be of the materials hereinabove specified and shall have
a minimum diameter of six inches, and, when practicable a minimum length of
three feet. Storm sewers serving local retail stores or commercial, light
industrial or other business establishments shall be of the same material
herein specified but shall be of such diameter as the Engineer shall specify,
based upon the sewage capacity of such store or establishment.
(Ord. 1958-130. Passed 11-25-58; Ord. 2006-022. Passed 3-7-06.)
915.09  PHOTOGRAPHS OF SEWERS REQUIRED.
   (a)    The Engineer is hereby directed, prior to final approval of any newly
installed sewer system and/or reconstructed sewer, to require that any and all
contractors cause photographs to be made of the entire sewer system installed,
showing thereby that the sewer system has been constructed upon sound
engineering basis and that the sewer system is free of any and all
accumulations of foreign substance and nature and that the passage and flow of
sewage and storm water is free and clear.
   (b)    Upon inspection of such photographs and if satisfied that such sewer
is free and clear of all foreign substance and there is nothing present to
prevent free flow of sewage and storm waters, the Engineer is authorized to
approve same as a final inspection, placing in safekeeping all photographs for
future reference by the City.
   (c)    The cost of such photographing and photographs shall be entirely paid
for by the contractor or developer of such land and/or sewer system, and such
photographs shall remain the property of the City.
(Ord. 1964-61. Passed 5-12-64; Ord. 2006-022. Passed 3-7-06.)
915.10 CONFLICT OF LAWS.
   The requirement of this chapter shall take precedence over any sewer
requirements as to material and size in any Building Code, Plumbing Code or
other ordinance or resolution of the Municipality, except for the optional use
of cast-iron pipe when imbedded in concrete slabs, and any section of any
ordinance, resolution, code or regulation of this Municipality inconsistent
with or contrary to the requirements of this chapter, with the exception noted,
is hereby repealed. However, the requirements of this chapter shall be deemed
minimum requirements and shall not affect the obligation to comply with any
additional or more exacting requirements prescribed by any ordinance,
resolution, code or regulation of this Municipality or of any other
governmental authority having jurisdiction over sewer requirements.
(Ord. 1958-130. Passed 11-25-58; Ord. 2006-022. Passed 3-7-06.)
915.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a misdemeanor of
the first degree and shall be required to replace any violating sewer with a
sewer meeting the requirements of this chapter.
(Ord. 2006-022. Passed 3-7-06.)

917.01 RESIDENTIAL COLLECTIONS; FREQUENCY.
   All refuse and garbage within the City shall be collected weekly upon
specific days of the week as provided by the Director of Public Service.
(Ord. 2016-037. Passed 2-16-16.)
917.011 RULES AND REGULATIONS
   The Director of Public Service is authorized to adopt rules and regulations
for receptacles to provide for uniform types of receptacles. All owners shall
assure that occupants comply with this requirement. (Ord. 2016-037. Passed 2-
16-16.)
917.012 CLASSIFICATION OF REFUSE
   All refuse offered for collection shall be divided into two classes, as
follows:
   (a)   Solid Waste: Such combustible material may be placed in a receptacle
with the garbage, such receptacle being covered by a properly fitted cover.
   (b)   Recyclables: Such incombustible materials shall not be placed in the
same receptacles with combustible material and garbage. All recyclable
materials can be placed together in the appropriate recycling container, such
receptacle being covered by a properly fitted cover.
      (Ord. 2016-037. Passed 2-16-16.)
917.013 CITY ISSUED RECEPTACLES
   The City, from time to time, may issue to residential users receptacles for
public collection, including 96 gallon and 65 gallon containers, for semi-
automated or automated collection methods. The residential user shall use the
receptacle furnished by the City and use it pursuant to this Chapter
917 and the regulations of the Director of Public Service. If a residential
user is issued a City receptacle, that user will be allowed to place up to only
those receptacle(s) provided, appropriate recycling containers and bulk solid
waste or trash for each weekly collection, provided that the user follows the
rules and regulations of the Director of Public Service and this Chapter
917 for proper depositing and collection of solid waste. These receptacles
cannot overflow and must be tightly closed. Excess rubbish shall be placed in
separate containers or rubbish bags and placed next to the City-issued
receptacle. The receptacles furnished by the City shall not be heavier than 50
pounds for 96 gallon receptacles. Receptacles furnished by the City to
residential users are property of the City and, if damaged, lost or destroyed,
such user will be charged the cost of replacing said receptacle. No other
receptacle in which refuse is offered for public collection other than
receptacles permitted by the rules and regulations promulgated by the Director
of Public Service shall be of greater capacity than 35 gallons, nor shall such
receptacles, including the contents thereof, be of greater weight than 50
pounds. (Ord. 2016-037. Passed 2-16-16.)
917.02 PLACEMENT AND TIME FOR COLLECTION.
   (a)   Trash, rubbish, garbage, refuse and recyclables may be placed for
collection not soooner than 5:00 p.m. the day before the scheduled collection
and all empty receptacles, trash, rubbish, garbage, refuse or recyclables, and
items not picked up must be removed from the tree lawn or curb on the same day.
Storage of trash, rubbish, garbage, refuse and recyclables must be stored in
the following locations:
      (1)   In the rear of the house out of public view (being seen from any
public street or sidewalk). Corner houses with storage in the rear must screen
behind landscaping, enclosure or fence.
      (2)   On the side of the house, but must be screened behind landscaping,
enclosure or fence.
      (3)   Inside of the garage.
   (b)   A building permit is required for the installation of enclosures and
fences.
   (c)   Storage of trash, rubbish, garbage, refuse and recyclables is
prohibited in the front of the house. (Ord. 2023-147. Passed 12-19-23.)
917.03 CONTAINERS.
   (a)   All refuse and garbage shall be stored in plastic receptacles, as
provided by the City, of not more than 96 gallon capacity, which shall weigh
not more than 50 pounds when full.
   (b)   Any refuse and garbage placed for collection that exceeds the limits
set forth herein shall be subject to a fine, as applicable, as set forth in
Section
917.08(b) of this Chapter.
(Ord. 2016-037. Passed 2-16-16.)
917.04  CERTAIN MATERIALS TO BE BUNDLED.
   Large boxes, crates, cartons and papers must be collapsed and tied in
bundles not longer than four feet, and weighing not more than 50 pounds. Tree
and hedge trimmings must be tied in bundles not over four feet in length and
not more than two feet in diameter.
(Ord. 2016-037. Passed 2-16-16.)
917.041 BULKY WASTE
   (a)   Bulky items including stoves, hot water tanks (water removed),
washers, dryers, furniture, chairs and carpet (4 feet in length) will be
collected on the scheduled collection day and shall be placed at least three
feet from the receptacle units.
   (b)   All upholstered furniture, chairs and mattresses must be placed in
bags.
   (c)   Automotive parts, construction materials, or excessive trash amounts
are not permissible items for collection.
   (d)   Any bulky waste placed for collection that exceeds the limits set
forth herein shall be subject to a fine, as applicable, as set forth in Section
917.08(b) of this Chapter.
(Ord. 2016-037. Passed 2-16-16.)
917.05  USE OF DRIVEWAYS BY COLLECTOR.
   City refuse and garbage collectors are not permitted to enter any house,
garage or other building in making collections. If, in collecting refuse and
garbage, the collector shall use the driveway of the householder, he shall do
so in a careful manner so as not to injure lawns or property outside the limits
of the driveway. Such collector is not authorized by the City to drive upon the
driveway of any householder for the purpose of collecting refuse or garbage
therefrom, and the City shall not be responsible for any damages caused by such
collector in so doing.
(Ord. 2016-037. Passed 2-16-16.)
917.06  HOURS FOR COLLECTION; HOLIDAYS.
   Refuse and garbage shall be picked up starting 7:00 a.m. on the day of
collection. If holidays fall on a regular collection day, refuse and garbage
will be picked up on the next working day. (Ord. 2016-037. Passed 2-16-16.)
917.07  COLLECTION IN RETAIL, COMMERCIAL AND INDUSTRIAL AREAS; FEES. (REPEALED)
   EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
 917.07 was repealed by Ordinance 2016-037.

   (a)   In the event of a violation of any of the provisions of this chapter
by any householder or other resident or person or by any retail, commercial or
industrial user in the City, from whom refuse and garbage is being collected,

suspended until such time as the violation is corrected and subject to a fine
as set forth in Section
917.08(b) of this Chapter.
   (b)   Any owner, householder, resident or other person or such retail,
commercial or industrial user that places refuse and garbage for collection in
violation of this Chapter shall be subject to the following fines:

917.09 SCAVENGING.
   (a)    No person, firm or corporation may scavenge or remove rubbish stored
for collection from any tree lawn or collection point, unless it is on the tree
lawn abutting his, her or its property.
   (b)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor of the
fourth degree.
(Ord. 2016-037. Passed 2-16-16.)

Illicit Discharge and Connection to City
