941.01 RULES AND REGULATIONS.
   The following rules and regulations are hereby established for the purpose
of controlling the use of City parks and their facilities within the City and
governing the conduct of members of the public within the park:
   (a)   No alcoholic beverage of any kind, type or description shall be
brought within the park or consumed upon park premises.
   (b)   Vehicles, while within the park, shall be parked only in areas
established and designed as parking areas and at no other place or location.
   (c)   No person shall operate a vehicle upon any roadway, drive or other
portion of park property at a speed in excess of ten miles per hour.
   (d)   No vehicle shall be operated on, over or upon any portion of park
property other than roadways, drives, parking areas or other portions of park
property which have been established and designated as available for the use of
vehicles.
   (e)   In leaving the park property, no operator of a vehicle shall drive
such vehicle into or upon any public street without first bringing such vehicle
to a complete stop and determining that entrance upon the public street can be
made with safety.
   (f)   Stop signs for the purpose of controlling vehicle traffic shall be
erected within the park at each point where any park road or driveway connects
to a public road.
   (g)    No person shall willfully, intentionally or negligently destroy or
damage any portion of the park or any public property, signs, structures or
equipment located therein.
   (h)    No person shall take or remove any ornamental trees or bushes from
the grounds within the park or from their location therein.
   (i)    All rubbish, bottles, boxes or other similar items shall be deposited
in containers provided for that purpose within the park.
   (j)    No camping shall be permitted or carried on at any place within the
park.
   (k)    No person shall engage in archery or shoot any bow or arrow or
similar implement within the confines of the park nor shall any arrow or
similar article be so discharged as to come to rest at any point within the
park.
   (l)   No person shall play or practice at the game of golf within the park.
   (m)    No person shall fly or otherwise manipulate or operate any mechanical
airplane or similar device within the park.
   (n)    All dogs brought into the park shall at all times be kept confined
either in the vehicle of the owner or harborer of such dog or upon an adequate
leash and shall at all times be kept under the control of the person bringing
the same within the park.
   (o)    No person shall appear within the park except while clad in proper
clothing and no person shall appear within the park clad in such manner as to
cause or permit the lewd or indecent exposure of any portion of his or her
body.
   (p)    There shall be no fires or cooking in the park, except in the
structure known as the Senior Citizens Service Center.
   (q)    No person shall fail to cooperate in maintaining restrooms and
washrooms in a neat and sanitary condition.
   (r)    No person over the age of five years shall use the restrooms and
washrooms designated for the opposite sex.
   (s)    No person shall expose or offer for sale any food, beverage, article
or thing within the park, nor shall any person station or place any stand, cart
or vehicle for the transportation, sale or display of any such food, beverage,
article or thing within the park.
   (t)    No person shall paste, glue, tack or otherwise post any sign,
placard, advertisement or inscription, whatsoever, in the park or cause any
sign to be erected whatever, unless authorized pursuant to a permit issued by
the Safety Director.
   (u)    No person shall bring into the park or have in his possession, or set
off or otherwise cause to explode or discharge or burn, any firecracker,
torpedo, rocket or other fireworks or explosives of inflammable material. This
section shall not apply to persons who have been granted a permit for the
discharge of fireworks.
   (v)    No person shall wash, clean, wax or repair any vehicle or bicycle
within the park. (Minor emergency repairs shall be permitted.)
      (Ord. 1986-18. Passed 3-4-86.)
941.02 HOURS.
   No person, other than an employee of the City while on City business, shall
be allowed to enter or remain within the limits of the park one half hour after
official sundown and one half hour before official sunrise. Persons may remain
in the Senior Citizens Service Center before and after the hours heretofore
indicated pursuant to a permit authorized by the Safety Director and issued
upon the signature of the Chief of Police or the Safety Director.
(Ord. 1986-18. Passed 3-4-86.)
941.03 CITY RESIDENTS.
   The Warrensville Heights City parks are dedicated to the welfare and
enjoyment of the residents of this community and their guests while in the
presence of a resident, all others shall be subject to immediate ejection and
removal from the property of the park by any duly authorized police officer.
(Ord. 1986-18. Passed 3-4-86.)
941.04 POSTING OF RULES.
   The rules herein established shall be posted at the Senior Citizens Service
Center.
(Ord. 1986-18. Passed 3-4-86.)
941.05 VIOLATION OF RULES.
   (a)   Whoever violates any of such rules or regulations or fails or refuses
to comply therewith shall be subject to ejection and removal from the property
of the park by any duly authorized police officer.
   (b)    Whoever violates any City ordinance, State or Federal law shall be
subject to ejection and removal from the property of the park by any duly
authorized police officer in addition to being subject to the penalty
proscribed for the violation of the City ordinance, State or Federal law in
addition to the penalty proscribed for a violation of this chapter.
(Ord. 1986-18. Passed 3-4-86.)
.
941.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor.
(Ord. 1986-18. Passed 3-4-86.)
                                                                                                 
CHAPTER 943
Tree Removal and Regulation
943.01    Planting of trees and shrubs on public grounds; permit; certain trees
prohibited.
943.02    Removing, cutting, spraying trees and shrubs.
943.03    Protection against harmful substances and building operations.
943.04    Materials obstructing access to tree roots; open ground area.
943.05    Nuisances.
943.06    Abatement of nuisances; cost.
943.07    Removal of trees by City; charge.
943.08    Liability of City for property damage.
943.09    Payment of service charge.
943.99    Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Power to regulate shade trees and shrubbery - see Ohio R.C. 715.20
Assessments for tree planting or maintenance - see Ohio R.C. 727.011
Injury or destruction - see GEN. OFF.
541.06
 
 
 
 
943.01 PLANTING OF TREES AND SHRUBS ON PUBLIC GROUNDS; PERMIT; CERTAIN TREES
PROHIBITED.
   No tree, ornamental plant or shrub shall be planted on any public street,
tree lawn or public ground within the City, except with the written permission
of the Building Commissioner, who shall grant such permission only if he finds
that the proposed planting will not interfere with the appropriate public use
of such street or ground and is consistent with any plan of planting already in
effect thereon. Such permission shall specify the manner in which such planting
shall be done in order to insure such consistency and lack of interference.
Permission shall not be granted to any person to plant any tree on a public
street or tree lawn closer than forty feet to the next adjacent tree on the
street or tree lawn. No tree shall be planted closer than ten feet to any fire
hydrant or closer than two feet to any curb or sidewalk. No permission shall be
given to plant on any public street, tree lawn or public place any of the
following types of trees: poplar, bush elder, bass wood, willow, mulberry or
soft maple.
(Ord. 1949-62. Passed 10-19-49.)
943.02  REMOVING, CUTTING, SPRAYING TREES AND SHRUBS.
   No person shall remove, destroy, cut down, prune, spray or injure any tree,
ornamental plant or shrub in any public street, tree lawn or public ground
within the City, except with and in conformity with the written permission of
the Building Commissioner, which permission shall be given when the
Commissioner finds that the proposed action is necessary to preserve the
appropriate use of such street or public ground.
(Ord. 1949-62. Passed 10-19-49.)
943.03 PROTECTION AGAINST HARMFUL SUBSTANCES AND BUILDING OPERATIONS.
   No person shall permit any substance harmful to tree life to come in contact
with the soil surrounding the roots of any such tree, ornamental plant or shrub
in such manner as to kill or injure the same, or fail to provide a good and
sufficient protection for any such tree, ornamental plant or shrub against any
injury arising from any building operation.
(Ord. 1949-62. Passed 10-19-49.)
943.04 MATERIALS OBSTRUCTING ACCESS TO TREE ROOTS; OPEN GROUND AREA.
   No person shall place or maintain upon the ground in any public street, tree
lawn or public ground within the City, any stone, concrete or other impervious
material in such manner as to obstruct the free access of air and water to the
roots of any tree, plant or shrub. Maintenance of an area of less than nine
square feet of open ground around the base of the trunk of a tree three inches
in diameter, with an increase of one square foot of open ground for each two
inches increase in diameter, shall be considered a violation of this section.
(Ord. 1949-62. Passed 10-19-49.)
943.05  NUISANCES.
   The following acts, things and conditions done or existing within this City
are declared to constitute nuisances and are prohibited:
   (a)    Any poplar, bush elder, bass wood, willow, mulberry or soft maple
tree upon any street, tree lawn or public place, or so near thereto as to
permit the roots of such tree to penetrate through or under the surface
thereof.
   (b)    Any tree, plant or shrub, wherever located within the City, infected
with any parasite, insect, disease or pest which may be communicated to any
other tree, plant or shrub.
   (c)    Any tree which, because of decay, injury or other condition, is apt
to fall in whole or in part upon or across any street or public place.
   (d)    Any tree, plant or shrub whose branches or trunk obstructs or impedes
traffic on any street or public place. Branches overhanging any public
sidewalk, pavement or roadway within nine feet of the surface thereof shall be
deemed prima facie to obstruct or impede traffic thereon.
   (e)   Any tree or part thereof growing upon private property but overhanging
or interfering with the use of any public right of way, park or public place,
which tree or part thereof, in the opinion of the Service Director, endangers
life, health, safety or property, shall be declared a public nuisance. The
owner of such property shall trim the branches so that they do not obstruct the
light from any street lamp or the view of any street intersection.
      (1)   The owner shall remove all dead, diseased or dangerous trees and
broken or decayed limbs which are a nuisance to the safety of the public.
      (2)   The owner may be notified in writing of the existence of the
nuisance and given a reasonable time for its correction or removal. If not
corrected or removed within the time allotted, the Director shall cause the
nuisance to be corrected or removed and the cost shall be assessed as provided
by law.
      (3)   The City may require the owner of any property within the City
limits to remove or destroy diseased trees growing or which have grown and died
upon property owned or occupied by him and which are a fire hazard or menace to
the public health, safety and welfare.
         (Ord. 2012-051. Passed 4-17-12.)
943.06 ABATEMENT OF NUISANCES; COST.
   Whenever in the opinion of the Building Commissioner any of the nuisances
defined in Section
943.05 exists, he shall cause written notice to be served upon the owner of the
property on which such nuisance is located, setting out the nature of the
nuisance and requiring its abatement within such reasonable time as he shall
determine. If the nuisance is not abated within the required time, the Director
of Public Service shall cause it to be abated, and such owner shall be served
in the manner provided by law with an account of the cost of such abatement. If
the cost is not paid within thirty days, the Director of Public Service shall
report the same to Council, which may assess the cost upon the property.
(Ord. 1949-62. Passed 10-19-49.)
943.07 REMOVAL OF TREES BY CITY; CHARGE.
   (a)   Upon application executed by a property owner within the City and
presented to the Clerk of Council, requesting the removal of a tree or trees
located within the City, the City, subject to the approval of the Director of
Public Service concerning the size and location of such trees and in accordance
with a service charge to be determined by the Director in an amount of not less
than the following:
      (1)   One hundred twenty-five dollars ($125.00) for a small tree (trunk
diameter two (2) inches or less).
      (2)   Two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) for a medium tree (trunk
diameter two (2) inches to six (6) inches in diameter).
      (3)   Five hundred dollars ($500.00) for a large tree (trunk diameter
greater than six (6) inches in diameter).
   The City shall make arrangements to provide equipment and will remove such
trees within the corporate limits.
   (b)   Whenever a tree is located upon private property and such tree or a
part thereof is found to be in a dead or dangerous condition and is so located
that if such tree fell, or such part thereof broke off and fell, it could
endanger life or property upon a street or upon other public property, the
Service Director shall give written notice by personal service or by regular
and/or registered mail to the owner of the property upon which such tree is
located to remove such tree or part thereof within ten (10) days of the date of
service or mailing of such notice. Failure of the owner of such premises to
remove such tree or part thereof within ten (10) days shall be deemed a
violation of this section.
   (c)   Whenever a tree is located upon private property and such tree or a
part thereof is found to be in a dead or dangerous condition and is so located
that if such tree fell, or such part thereof broke off and fell, it could
endanger life or property upon the premises where such tree is located, or upon
other private property, the Service Director shall give written notice by
personal service or by certified or registered mail to the owner of the
property upon which such tree is located to remove such tree or part thereof
within thirty days of the date of service or mailing of such notice. Failure of
the owner of such premises to remove such tree or part thereof within ten (10)
days shall be deemed a violation of this section.
   (d)   Subject to the approval of the Director of Public Service concerning
the size and location of such trees and in accordance with a service charge to
be determined by the Director in an amount of not less than the following:
      (1)   Two hundred fifty dollars ($250.00) for a small tree (trunk
diameter two (2) inches or less).
      (2)   Five hundred dollars ($500.00) for a medium tree (trunk diameter
two (2) inches to six (6) inches in diameter).
      (3)   One thousand dollars ($1,000) for a large tree (trunk diameter
greater than six (6) inches in diameter).
   The City shall make arrangements to provide equipment and will remove such
trees within the corporate limits. (Ord. 2012-052. Passed 4-17-12.)
943.08 LIABILITY OF CITY FOR PROPERTY DAMAGE.
   The applicant shall absolve the City from all liability, either directly or
indirectly, from all property damage in connection with the removal of such
trees as shall be indicated upon the application. (Ord. 1953-21. Passed 2-18-
53.)
943.09 PAYMENT OF SERVICE CHARGE.
   The service charge for the removal of such trees shall be payable with the
application.
(Ord. 1956-23. Passed 2-20-56.)
943.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor. Each day's violation shall constitute a separate offense.
                                                                                                   
CHAPTER 945
Noxious Weeds and Weeds, Grass and Plant Control
945.01   Affected property.
945.02   Destruction of noxious weeds.
945.03   Height limit on weeds, grass or plants.
945.04   Written notice.
945.05   Service of notice.
945.06   Remedy of City for non-compliance.
945.07   Reimbursement to City for unpaid bills.
945.08   Statement to County Auditor.
945.09   Right of appeal.
945.99   Penalty.
 
CROSS REFERENCES
Procedure for notice to cut noxious weeds - see Ohio R.C. 731.51 et seq.
Destruction of weeds - see Ohio R.C. 971.33 et seq.
 
 
 
 
945.01 AFFECTED PROPERTY.
   Every owner, lessee, agent or tenant having charge of the following
described lots or lands within the City shall be required to cut noxious weeds
as hereinafter described:
   (a)   All sublots in a recorded subdivision in their entirety.
   (b)   All land which lies within twenty feet of a lot line which is adjacent
to lots or lands upon which a residential or commercial building exists.
   (c)   All land which lies within 120 feet of a dedicated thoroughfare.
      (Ord. 2004-067. Passed 6-15-04.)
945.02 DESTRUCTION OF NOXIOUS WEEDS.
   Every owner, lessee, agent or tenant having charge of any lot or land
described in Section
945.01, shall cause the lot or lands to be kept free from Russian, Canadian or
common thistle, wild lettuce, wild mustard, wild parsley, ragweed, milkweed,
ironweed and all other noxious weeds growing or being upon the lot or lands as
aforesaid, by destroying the noxious weeds by spraying with a chemical compound
approved by the Director of Public Service, by cutting, by digging under or by
any other method approved by the Director.
(Ord. 2004-067. Passed 6-15-04.)
945.03 HEIGHT LIMIT ON WEEDS, GRASS OR PLANTS.
   It shall be unlawful for the owner, lessee, agent or tenant having charge of
any lot or land described in Section
945.01  to permit any weeds, grass, or plants, other than trees, bushes,
flowers or other ornamental plants, to grow to a height exceeding six inches.
Any such weeds, grass, or plants exceeding such height are hereby declared to
be a nuisance. The owner or any other person having charge of such property
described in Section
945.01  must assure that the height of the weeds, grass or plants does not
exceed six inches.
(Ord. 2006-082. Passed 5-16-06.)
945.04 WRITTEN NOTICE.
     (a)   Notwithstanding the penalty contained in Section
945.99, and in addition thereto, when the Building Commissioner ascertains that
either noxious weeds, as described in Section
945.02 are growing on lands within the City, he/she shall cause written notice
to be served upon the owner, lessee, agent or tenant having charge of such
lands that either noxious weeds, or weeds, grass and plants are growing on such
lands in violation of Section
945.02 or Section
945.03, they must be destroyed by any of the methods set forth in Section
945.02, and as to weeds, grass and plants they must be cut to a height no more
than six inches, and that such destruction must be commenced within three days
after the service of the notice and maintained throughout the remainder of the
grass cutting season. Only one notice to the owner, lessee, agent or tenant as
provided in this section shall be necessary in any one grass cutting season.
The notice shall indicate that noxious weeds or weeds, grass and plants not
destroyed or cut by a certain date, determined by the Building Commissioner,
taking into account the weather conditions and projected growing season of each
year will be destroyed or cut by the City and the owner, lessee, agent or
tenant of the property charged with the cost, and that only one written notice
will be given so that if the property owner is in violation of this chapter at
any future date during the grass cutting season, the nuisance will be abated
pursuant to this chapter without further notice. If the owner or other person
having charge of the lands is a nonresident whose address is known, the notice
shall be sent to his address by registered mail; if the address of the owner is
unknown, it shall be sufficient to publish the notice once in a newspaper of
general circulation in the City.
   
   (b)   If public notice is placed in a newspaper of general circulation in
the City to notify the owner or other person having charge of the land, the
cost of placing that notice must be paid by the owner or other person having
charge of the land.
(Ord. 2015-058. Passed 5-19-15.)
945.05 SERVICE OF NOTICE.
   Any police officer, housing department official or other person designated
by the Building Commissioner may make service and return of the notice provided
for in Section
945.04.
(Ord. 2004-067. Passed 6-15-04.)
945.06 REMEDY OF CITY FOR NONCOMPLIANCE.
   If the owner, lessee, agent or tenant having charge of the lands mentioned
in Section
945.01 fails to comply with the notice, the Director of Public Service or
someone working under his/her direction and employment, may employ the
necessary labor to enter upon the affected property and cause the noxious weeds
to be destroyed and/or weeds, grass or plants to be cut.
(Ord. 2004-067. Passed 6-15-04.)
945.07 REIMBURSEMENT TO CITY FOR UNPAID BILLS.
   (a)   Whenever the Director of Public Service shall authorize that any
parcel of land shall be entered upon in order to accomplish abatement of an
existing violation, pursuant to provisions of this chapter, the Director of
Public Service is hereby authorized and directed to keep an accurate account of
all expenses incurred, and, based upon same, issue an invoice indicating the
cost involved for such work with respect to each parcel of property.
   (b)   Once noxious weeds are destroyed or weed, grass or plant cutting is
completed, the Director of Public Service is authorized to charge the owner,
lessee, agent or tenant having charge of the affected property for the services
rendered.
   (c)   The Director of Finance shall notify the owner, lessee, agent or
tenant having charge of the affected property by ordinary mail, if the address
of such parties be known, that the City has destroyed the noxious weeds or has
cut the weeds, grass or plants upon the premises in accordance with the
provisions of this chapter, and then report all the expenses to Council.
   (d)   The Director is also authorized to add to such costs a fifty dollar
($50.00) administrative charge to cover the costs of publication, overhead and
other contingent expenses.
   (e)   Within ten days after receipt of the requisition, the Finance Director
shall forward a statement of the total charges assessed on each parcel of
property to the person as shown to be the owner of record on the last current
assessment of tax roll and such assessment shall be payable to the City within
thirty days from the date the statement was forwarded.
   (f)   If the property owner does not pay these expenses within the thirty
days period, the City may file a lien against the subject property in
accordance with Section
945.08 with the County Auditor. Such amount shall be a debt of the person to
whom assessed until paid and, in case of delinquency, may be enforced as
delinquent City property taxes or by a suit against such person.
   (g)   Such amounts as are paid to the City under the provisions of this
chapter shall be deposited into a special fund to be known as the “Weed and
Refuse Fund” and these monies may be drawn upon the Finance Director for the
purpose of defraying the expenses incurred by the Director of Public Service in
the performance of such work as may be necessary to accomplish abatement of
violations in the manner specified in this chapter.
(Ord. 2005-131. Passed 8-2-05.)
945.08 STATEMENT TO COUNTY AUDITOR.
   Upon the receipt of the statement of expenses incurred, Council shall make
written return to the County Auditor of Cuyahoga County of its action under the
preceding sections with a statement of the charges for their services, the
amount paid for labor and a proper description of the premises for the purpose
of making the same a lien upon the lands to be collected as other taxes and
returned to the Municipality with the General Fund.
(Ord. 2004-067. Passed 6-15-04.)
945.09 RIGHT OF APPEAL.
   (a)   Upon notice of violation of this chapter from the Building
Commissioner, the owner or other person having charge of the land may appeal
such violation to the Board of Zoning Appeals, pursuant to Section
1379.08 of the Building Code, and as further modified herein.
   (b)   Where the notice contains a violation of Chapter 945, and the owner,
lessee, agent or tenant having charge of the lands mentioned in Section
945.01 fails to comply with the notice within the time prescribed in such
notice, the Building Commissioner or the Director of Public Service may
authorize the immediate destruction of noxious weeds or the immediate abatement
of the nuisance by the City notwithstanding the pendency of an appeal of such
order/notice to the Board of Zoning Appeals. If, as a result of such appeal,
the Board overturns the order of the Building Commissioner or the Director of
Public Service, then the owner shall not be obligated to pay to the City its
costs in either destroying the noxious weeds or in abating the nuisance. (Ord.
2004-067. Passed 6-15-04.)
945.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter is guilty of a minor
misdemeanor. Each day’s violation shall constitute a separate offense.
(Ord. 2004-067. Passed 6-15-04.)
